wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the STEM Learning App. Explain its purpose as an offline-first, gamified educational platform for students aged 10-20 in Zambia. Detail the core goals of delivering accessible STEM education through interactive learning, gamification (XP, badges, leaderboards), and personalized progress tracking. Describe the target audience, key features, and high-level architecture. Include information about the React Native and Expo foundation, TypeScript usage, and offline-first design. Provide context on how the app supports both guest and authenticated users, and highlight the integration of AI-driven recommendations. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as 'Zustand stores', 'Expo Router', and 'SQLite persistence'. Include practical examples from the actual implementation, such as navigation flow from splash screen to dashboard. Address common onboarding issues and performance considerations for low-end devices in educational settings.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reusable UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Button.tsx component, a foundational UI element in the STEM Learning App. Thoroughly explain its implementation, including all props (title, onPress, variant, size, disabled, loading, fullWidth, icon, style, textStyle, theme), their types, and usage patterns. Document how the component supports multiple variants (primary, secondary, outline, ghost) and sizes (small, medium, large) with dynamic styling based on theme and state. Include practical examples showing how to use the button in different contexts, such as with icons, in loading states, and across light/dark themes. Explain the integration with the global theme system via Colors, BorderRadius, Spacing, and Typography from constants/theme. Address accessibility features like disabled state handling and touchable opacity. Discuss performance considerations, such as memoization opportunities, and best practices for extending or customizing the component while maintaining design consistency. Illustrate how the component handles responsive layout and integrates with parent forms or navigation flows.

wiki_catalogs.name: File-Based Routing with Expo Router
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the file-based routing implementation using Expo Router in the STEM Learning App. Explain how the app directory structure directly maps to navigable routes, including special directories like (tabs) for grouping tabbed screens. Detail the role of _layout.tsx files in defining shared UI, providers, and navigation wrappers at different levels of the route hierarchy. Use examples from app/_layout.tsx to demonstrate root-level providers and navigation setup, and from app/index.tsx to show the splash screen route and initial navigation logic. Document best practices for route naming, dynamic segments, and nested routing. Address common issues such as route resolution order, handling deep links, and debugging missing routes. Include performance considerations like route preloading and code splitting strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Auth Store implementation in services/store.ts. Thoroughly explain the Zustand store interface including user, isAuthenticated, and isLoading states. Document the initialization process that checks current user status and updates last active time and streak. Detail the login and register functions, including their interaction with database.authenticateUser and database.createUser, error handling for duplicate constraints, and secure session management via Expo SecureStore. Explain the logout function's secure token cleanup and state reset. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how UI components like welcome.tsx dispatch login/register actions. Address common issues such as authentication persistence across app restarts and race conditions during initialization. Provide best practices for extending the auth store with social login or biometric authentication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the SQLite database schema in the STEM Learning App. Detail all 12 database tables including users, subjects, topics, lessons, quizzes, questions, quiz_attempts, badges, achievements, user_progress, streaks, and leaderboard. For each table, document field definitions, data types, primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints. Explain entity relationships such as user-to-progress, topic-to-lessons, and quiz-to-attempts. Include sample data and usage scenarios like tracking topic completion or calculating user XP. Use code snippets from database.ts to illustrate table creation and relationships. Address data validation rules and business logic such as how quiz scores impact XP rewards. Provide a schema diagram showing table relationships and data flow.

wiki_catalogs.name: Registration System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the registration system of the STEM Learning App. Explain the complete registration flow from form input to user creation in the database, as implemented in welcome.tsx and useAuthStore. Detail how user data is validated (name, age, gender, grade, password), how usernames are auto-generated from full names, and how password confirmation is enforced. Document the createUser function in database.ts that inserts user records with plain-text passwords into the SQLite database. Include code examples showing form validation logic, error handling for duplicate usernames (UNIQUE constraint), and the auto-login behavior after successful registration. Address security considerations from AUTH_GUIDE.md regarding local-only storage and the implications of plain-text password storage in an offline-first context. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common registration issues like validation failures and username collisions.

wiki_catalogs.name: XP and Leveling System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the XP and leveling system implementation in the STEM Learning App. Explain how XP is awarded for completing lessons and quizzes, stored in the users table, and used to calculate user levels. Document the XP-to-level progression algorithm, including threshold calculations and level-up events. Include code examples from database.ts showing the createUser and updateUser functions that manage XP and level fields. Describe how the Zustand store synchronizes XP changes across components and triggers UI updates. Address configuration options for XP rewards per content type and provide guidance on modifying the leveling curve. Explain integration with the leaderboard system and how level data is displayed in user profiles and ranking views.

wiki_catalogs.name: Home Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Home Screen feature. Thoroughly explain its implementation in home.tsx, including the display of user stats (XP Points, Badges, Streak), level progress visualization with dynamic XP bar, AI-powered learning suggestions, and quick action navigation cards. Document how data flows from Zustand stores (useAuthStore, useLearningStore) to UI components, and how pull-to-refresh triggers state synchronization. Include code examples showing integration with theme system, navigation via useRouter, and responsive layout using StyleSheet. Address performance considerations for rendering multiple stat cards and scrollable content, accessibility features like proper contrast and text scaling, and extensibility patterns for adding new quick actions or AI recommendation types. Explain relationships with services/store.ts and constants/theme.ts, and provide guidance on customizing the AI suggestion logic or extending the stats section.

wiki_catalogs.name: Root Layout
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content focused on the root layout implementation in app/_layout.tsx. Explain its role in initializing the application lifecycle, coordinating the splash screen with Expo's SplashScreen API, and managing the Stack navigator configuration via Expo Router. Detail how it integrates with Zustand stores (useAppStore, useAuthStore, useThemeStore) to handle app initialization, authentication state, and theme-aware rendering. Describe the step-by-step flow of the prepare() function, including database and state initialization, artificial delay for branding, and error resilience. Illustrate how the loading state is managed before hiding the splash screen, ensuring all critical systems are ready. Document the Stack navigator screen configurations, including animation types (slide_from_right, fade), header visibility, and dynamic styling based on the current theme. Provide code examples showing how to add new stack screens with custom headers and styling. Address common issues such as splash screen hanging, theme flickering during startup, and race conditions between store initialization and navigation, along with their solutions. Include performance considerations like minimizing initialization overhead and optimizing the loading sequence for faster startup.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack & Dependencies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack of the STEM Learning App. Explain the role of React Native with Expo in enabling cross-platform mobile development, and detail why Expo was chosen for rapid iteration and device API access. Document the use of TypeScript for type safety across components, services, and state management. Describe key dependencies including Zustand for lightweight global state, Expo SQLite for local data persistence, and Expo Router for file-based routing. Include version information from package.json and explain how configuration in app.json and eas.json supports build and deployment via EAS. Provide practical examples of how these technologies interact, such as how Zustand stores sync with SQLite through database.ts. Address integration challenges, compatibility considerations, and performance implications of the chosen stack. Include guidance on setting up the development environment and troubleshooting dependency conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content focused on the application's layout architecture, covering both the root layout (app/_layout.tsx) and tab navigation layout (app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx). Explain the role of the root layout in initializing the app state, managing the splash screen lifecycle, and setting up the Stack navigator with proper screen options for animations and styling. Detail how it integrates with Zustand stores (useAppStore, useAuthStore, useThemeStore) to coordinate initialization, authentication state, and theme-aware rendering. Describe the loading state management and splash screen hiding logic. For the tab layout, document the configuration of the bottom tab navigator using Expo Router's Tabs component, including tab bar styling, icon rendering with MaterialIcons, and theme-responsive color settings. Illustrate how navigation state is preserved across tabs and how the layout enforces consistent UI behavior. Provide code examples showing how new screens can be added to either stack or tab navigators. Address common issues like navigation glitches, theme flickering, and initialization race conditions, along with their solutions. Include performance tips such as lazy loading and memory management for tab transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tab Navigation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the tab navigation system implemented in the (tabs) directory. Explain how app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx configures the bottom tab navigator using Expo Router's layout system, including tab icons, labels, and screen options. Describe the integration between the tab layout and individual tab screens (home, learn, leaderboard, profile), highlighting state sharing and reinitialization behaviors. Use real code examples to demonstrate tab press handling, screen unmounting/remounting, and persistence of tab state. Address common challenges such as preventing unnecessary re-renders, managing tab-specific data loading, and customizing tab bar appearance with theme support. Include guidance on adding new tabs and modifying tab navigation behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Theme Store implementation in services/store.ts. Explain the theme state management with 'light' and 'dark' modes, including initialization from SecureStore and persistence of user preferences. Document the setTheme and toggleTheme functions, detailing how theme changes are saved securely and synchronized with the database when a user is authenticated. Describe the integration with the global theme configuration in constants/theme.ts and how UI components consume theme state. Provide examples from profile.tsx showing theme toggle implementation. Address common issues like theme flicker on startup, inconsistent styling across components, and proper handling of theme changes during navigation. Include performance considerations for minimizing re-renders and best practices for extending the theme system with custom themes or dynamic color generation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the TypeScript data models used in the application. Thoroughly explain each interface defined in types/index.ts including User, Subject, Topic, Lesson, Quiz, Question, QuizAttempt, Badge, Achievement, UserProgress, Streak, and LeaderboardEntry. Document property types, required/optional fields, and their mapping to database columns. Include examples of model instantiation and usage in services. Explain how type safety is enforced across the application and how models are validated before database operations. Address recent changes such as the evolution of educationLevel from 'postgraduate' to include 'masters' and 'phd' as documented in EDUCATION_LEVELS_UPDATE.md. Provide code examples showing type usage in database queries and state management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Login System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the login system of the STEM Learning App. Explain the login workflow from credential input to session establishment, as implemented in welcome.tsx and useAuthStore. Detail how the authenticateUser function in database.ts queries the database using username and password, updates the user's lastActive timestamp, and stores the session identifier in Expo Secure Store. Document the Zustand login action that manages loading states, handles authentication responses, and updates global authentication state. Include code examples showing the login form implementation, error handling for invalid credentials, and navigation to the dashboard upon success. Address security aspects from AUTH_GUIDE.md including local-only authentication, secure session storage, and the absence of network transmission. Provide troubleshooting guidance for login failures, session persistence issues, and edge cases like offline attempts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Badge and Achievement System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the badge and achievement system in the STEM Learning App. Explain the implementation of badge unlocking logic based on XP thresholds, completed topics, and streak milestones as defined in the badges and achievements tables. Document the data models including badge categories, requirements, and progress tracking. Include code examples from database.ts showing how achievements are inserted when requirements are met. Describe how the Zustand store manages achievement state and notifies the UI. Explain the display of badges in the profile screen with locked/unlocked states and progress indicators. Provide guidance on adding new badge types, modifying requirements, and creating achievement animations. Address performance considerations when checking multiple achievement conditions during user activities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Learn Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Learn Screen feature. Thoroughly explain its implementation in learn.tsx, including subject browsing with color-coded cards, topic progress tracking using percentage bars and progress circles, and navigation to detailed subject views. Document how the screen consumes data from useLearningStore for subjects and progress, renders dynamic progress indicators, and implements pull-to-refresh functionality. Include code examples showing the subject card layout, progress circle SVG-like implementation using absolute positioning, and stats grid for 'Your Learning Journey'. Address performance considerations for list rendering and image loading, accessibility compliance for color contrast and touch targets, and extensibility for adding new subject categories or progress visualization types. Explain relationships with constants/theme.ts for SUBJECT_CONFIG and services/store.ts, and provide guidance on integrating actual progress calculations instead of placeholder logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tab Navigation Layout
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the tab navigation layout in app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx. Thoroughly explain how the Tabs component from Expo Router is configured to provide bottom tab navigation across the main app sections: Home, Learn, Leaderboard, and Profile. Document the screenOptions configuration, including header visibility, tab bar styling (background color, border, height, padding), and text styling (font size, weight). Detail how the active and inactive tab colors are dynamically set based on the current theme using useThemeStore and the Colors constants. Explain the implementation of tab bar icons using MaterialIcons, including the logic for selecting icon variants (e.g., filled vs outlined) based on focus state. Provide code examples demonstrating how to add a new tab, customize icon appearance, and modify tab behavior. Illustrate how navigation state is preserved within each tab and how the layout ensures consistent UI across themes. Address common issues such as incorrect icon rendering, theme mismatch in tab bar, and navigation glitches when switching tabs rapidly, along with their solutions. Include best practices for accessibility, such as proper labeling and touch target sizing, and performance tips like icon preloading and minimizing re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on onboarding new developers to the STEM Learning App. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository, installing dependencies using npm or yarn, and configuring the development environment. Include setup instructions for Expo CLI, EAS Build, and required tools like Node.js and Watchman. Walk through running the app on iOS, Android, and web targets using 'npx expo start'. Highlight critical configuration files such as app.json and eas.json, and explain how to modify them for custom builds. Use concrete examples from QUICKSTART.md and BUILD_GUIDE.md to illustrate common workflows. Address frequent setup issues such as Metro bundler errors, device connection problems, and permission configuration. Include tips for verifying a successful installation and launching the app on emulator or physical device.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Navigation Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the end-to-end navigation flow in the STEM Learning App. Explain the sequence from app launch at app/index.tsx (splash screen) through authentication checks to either the welcome screen or direct dashboard access. Describe how the authentication state in Zustand store influences navigation decisions and prevents unauthorized access to tabbed screens. Use code examples to illustrate navigation guards, conditional routing based on user state, and seamless transitions between unauthenticated and authenticated flows. Document the handoff between the initial route and the tab navigator, including state transfer and theme persistence. Address common issues such as race conditions during startup, handling back navigation from authenticated screens, and deep linking into tabbed sections. Include testing strategies for navigation logic and performance optimization for smooth screen transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Learning Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Learning Store implementation in services/store.ts. Explain the state structure including subjects, topics, lessons, and progress tracking. Document the loadSubjects, loadTopics, and loadLessons functions and their database interactions for fetching educational content. Detail the setCurrentSubject, setCurrentTopic, and setCurrentLesson functions for navigation state management. Explain the updateProgress and loadProgress functions, including how completion percentages are stored per topic and synchronized with the database. Describe the completeLesson function that triggers XP rewards and leaderboard updates. Provide examples from learn.tsx showing how components subscribe to learning state and trigger actions. Address common issues like stale data after navigation, progress synchronization delays, and loading state management. Include best practices for optimizing data fetching and handling large lesson sets efficiently.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for all database operations implemented in database.ts. Cover connection management, initialization, and transaction handling. Document CRUD operations for each entity with code examples showing how to create a user, retrieve lessons for a topic, record quiz attempts, and update user progress. Explain authentication-related operations like createUser and authenticateUser with examples from AUTH_GUIDE.md. Detail how SecureStore integrates with database operations for session management. Include error handling patterns for database operations and strategies for handling concurrent access. Provide performance optimization tips such as query indexing and efficient data retrieval patterns for mobile devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the session management system of the STEM Learning App. Explain how user sessions are established during login and registration, maintained across app restarts, and destroyed during logout. Detail the initialize function in useAuthStore that checks for an existing user session by retrieving the current_user_id from Expo Secure Store and loading the corresponding user data from the database. Document the logout function that removes the session token and clears the authentication state. Include code examples showing session persistence, auto-login behavior, and integration with the database's getCurrentUser function. Address security considerations from AUTH_GUIDE.md regarding secure storage of session identifiers and the implications of local-only session management. Provide troubleshooting guidance for session timeout issues, auto-login failures, and orphaned session data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Streak Tracking System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the streak tracking system in the STEM Learning App. Explain how daily learning streaks are recorded in the streaks table, validated against consecutive days, and used to calculate bonus XP. Document the data model including date, completion status, and XP earned per streak day. Include code examples from database.ts showing streak validation and update logic. Describe how the Zustand store maintains streak state and triggers streak-related events. Explain the display of streak information on the home screen with visual indicators and how broken streaks are handled. Provide guidance on configuring streak reward multipliers and implementing streak freeze features. Address timezone considerations and offline synchronization of streak data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Profile Screen feature. Thoroughly explain its implementation in profile.tsx, including user information display, achievement tracking with badge grid, streak calendar visualization, and settings management. Document how the screen integrates with useAuthStore for user data and logout functionality, uses toggleTheme from useThemeStore, and displays level progression with XP calculations via getLevelInfo. Include code examples showing the avatar edit button overlay, responsive badge grid layout, 7-day streak calendar with checkmarks, and themed settings list with logout confirmation. Address accessibility considerations for colorblind users in badge states, performance optimization for rendering multiple touchable items, and extensibility for adding new settings or integrating actual badge data from the database. Explain relationships with services/store.ts and constants/theme.ts, and provide guidance on connecting the sample data to actual database queries in services/database.ts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the UI component architecture of the STEM Learning App. Explain the modular design pattern used across the application, emphasizing reusability and separation of concerns. Detail the implementation of the Button.tsx component, including its props, styling, and event handling. Describe how layout components like _layout.tsx manage navigation, theme context, and global state initialization. Illustrate the component hierarchy starting from root layout through tab-based navigation to individual screens. Use actual code examples to show how components consume Zustand stores and respond to user interactions. Address accessibility considerations, responsive design patterns, and theming integration. Include best practices for creating new components and ensuring consistency with existing UI patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Quiz Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Quiz Store implementation in services/store.ts. Explain the state management for active quizzes including currentQuiz, questions, answers, and timing. Document the loadQuiz function that fetches quiz data and questions from the database, and the startQuiz function that initializes quiz attempts. Detail the answerQuestion, nextQuestion, and previousQuestion functions for managing user responses and navigation through questions. Explain the endQuiz function that calculates scores, saves attempts to the database, awards XP based on performance (including bonus XP for perfect scores), and updates user progress. Describe the resetQuiz and getCurrentQuestion utility functions. Provide examples of quiz flow implementation in learn.tsx. Address common issues like time tracking accuracy, answer persistence during interruptions, and handling of incomplete quiz attempts. Include best practices for quiz state management and performance optimization during high-frequency state updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Migrations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the database migration system in the STEM Learning App. Explain the versioning strategy using database version numbers and how migrations are triggered when version numbers change. Detail specific migration examples such as the update from version 4 to 5 that replaced gradeLevel with educationLevel, and version 5 to 6 that further refined education levels to include 'masters' and 'phd'. Document the migration logic for altering tables, transforming data, and maintaining backward compatibility. Include code examples from DATABASE_STRUCTURE_UPDATES.md showing ALTER TABLE operations and data mapping logic. Explain how migration functions handle both new installations and existing user data. Address best practices for writing safe migrations that preserve user data and handle edge cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Considerations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content focused on the security model of the STEM Learning App's authentication system. Explain the offline-first security architecture where all credentials and user data remain on-device, never transmitted over the network. Detail the current implementation of plain-text password storage in SQLite and justify this design choice for an offline educational app in low-connectivity regions. Document the use of Expo Secure Store for protecting session identifiers. Discuss the implications of no password recovery mechanism and the risks of account data loss. Include future security improvement recommendations from AUTH_GUIDE.md such as password hashing with SHA-256, unique username validation, and potential security question-based recovery. Provide guidance on evaluating the trade-offs between usability and security in this specific deployment context.

wiki_catalogs.name: Leaderboard Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the leaderboard implementation in the STEM Learning App. Explain the ranking algorithm that sorts users by total XP from the users table and assigns positions stored in the leaderboard table. Document the database schema including rank, totalXp, and level fields, and describe the updateLeaderboard() function that recalculates rankings. Include code examples from leaderboard.tsx showing the podium display for top 3 users with medal indicators and the FlatList implementation for the remaining rankings. Describe the pull-to-refresh functionality, loading states, and current user highlighting. Explain the personal stats card that shows the user's rank and XP. Address performance optimizations like limiting results to top 50 users and efficient SQL queries. Provide guidance on extending the system with time-based or category-specific leaderboards as suggested in LEADERBOARD_FEATURE.md.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing & Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the routing and navigation system in the STEM Learning App. Explain how Expo Router enables file-based routing with the app directory structure, and how nested layouts manage shared UI and state. Detail the implementation of tab-based navigation in (tabs)/_layout.tsx and how it integrates with the root _layout.tsx. Describe the navigation flow from splash screen (index.tsx) to authentication (welcome.tsx) and into the main tab navigator. Use real code examples to demonstrate screen transitions, deep linking, and navigation guards. Address common issues such as navigation state persistence, tab reinitialization, and handling back button behavior. Include performance optimization tips for navigation, such as lazy loading and screen preloading strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: App Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the App Store implementation in services/store.ts. Explain the global UI state management including isInitialized, isOnline, and notificationCount. Document the initialize function that orchestrates the startup sequence by initializing the database, theme, authentication, and learning stores in the correct order. Detail how the App Store serves as the central coordinator for app-wide state and ensures proper initialization before rendering the main interface. Explain the setOnlineStatus and setNotificationCount functions for managing connectivity and UI indicators. Provide examples from _layout.tsx showing how the app waits for initialization before rendering tabs. Address common issues like initialization race conditions, handling failed initialization gracefully, and managing app state during background/foreground transitions. Include best practices for extending the App Store with additional global state like loading indicators or error banners.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Zustand-based state management system in the STEM Learning App. Explain the architecture of global stores for authentication, theme, learning progress, and quiz state. Detail how store.ts defines and composes multiple Zustand stores, and how they interact with the database service for persistence. Describe the pattern of state updates triggered by user actions and synchronized with SQLite. Use concrete examples from the codebase to show how components subscribe to state changes and dispatch actions. Address best practices for store organization, avoiding unnecessary re-renders, and managing derived state. Include troubleshooting guidance for common state synchronization issues and performance bottlenecks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling & Theme System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the styling and theming implementation in the STEM Learning App. Explain how theme.ts defines the color palette, typography, spacing, and layout constants used throughout the application. Detail the theme provider pattern that enables dynamic light/dark mode switching and how components access theme values via context. Describe the design system principles followed in the app, including consistency in button styles, card layouts, and typography hierarchy. Use actual code examples to show how components consume theme variables and respond to theme changes. Address accessibility considerations such as contrast ratios and font scaling. Include guidance on extending the theme system with new variants or supporting additional customization options.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database & Data Persistence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the SQLite-based data persistence system in the STEM Learning App. Explain the offline-first architecture and how Expo SQLite enables local data storage for user progress, achievements, and preferences. Detail the implementation in database.ts, including connection management, CRUD operations, and transaction handling. Describe the data models defined in types/index.ts such as User, Subject, Topic, Lesson, Quiz, Badge, and LeaderboardEntry. Use code examples to illustrate common database interactions like saving quiz results or retrieving user streaks. Address database migration strategies documented in DATABASE_MIGRATION.md and schema evolution practices. Include performance considerations for query optimization, indexing, and storage limits on mobile devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the authentication system of the STEM Learning App. Explain the dual authentication flow supporting both registered users and guest mode, as implemented in welcome.tsx. Detail how user credentials are securely stored using Expo Secure Store and managed through Zustand authentication store. Describe the registration and login processes, including form validation, state management, and session persistence. Use actual code examples to show how authentication state affects navigation and UI rendering. Address security considerations documented in AUTH_GUIDE.md, such as password hashing, secure storage practices, and session timeout policies. Include troubleshooting guidance for common authentication issues and edge cases like offline login attempts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Gamification System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the gamification system in the STEM Learning App. Explain the implementation of XP accumulation, level progression, badge unlocking, and streak tracking as managed through Zustand stores and persisted in SQLite. Detail how user actions like completing lessons or quizzes trigger gamification events and update global state. Describe the leaderboard system implementation, including ranking algorithms, podium visualization, and performance considerations for sorting large datasets. Use code examples from leaderboard.tsx to illustrate data fetching and display patterns. Address design decisions documented in LEADERBOARD_FEATURE.md and how gamification elements enhance user engagement. Include guidance on adding new badge types or modifying XP reward calculations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the core features of the STEM Learning App. Provide an integrated overview of the main functionality accessible through the tab navigation: Home, Learn, Leaderboard, and Profile. Explain how home.tsx displays user stats (XP, badges, streak), level progress visualization, and AI recommendations. Detail how learn.tsx enables subject browsing, topic progress tracking, and learning journey navigation. Describe the profile management capabilities in profile.tsx including achievement display and theme preferences. Use actual code examples to show data flow from services to UI components. Address user experience considerations, performance optimization for data-heavy screens, and accessibility features. Include guidance on extending existing features or adding new ones while maintaining architectural consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Build & Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the build and deployment process for the STEM Learning App using Expo Application Services (EAS). Explain the configuration in eas.json for building iOS and Android binaries, including different build profiles and environment-specific settings. Detail how app.json defines application metadata, permissions, and platform-specific configurations. Walk through the EAS Build workflow from local development to production deployment, using documentation from EASDOC.md and BUILD_GUIDE.md. Include instructions for managing environment variables, code signing, and versioning. Address common build issues such as dependency conflicts, missing permissions, and platform-specific requirements. Provide best practices for release management, including staged rollouts and emergency hotfix procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the testing approach for the STEM Learning App. Explain the testing philosophy and workflow documented in TESTING.md, including unit, integration, and end-to-end testing strategies. Detail the tools and frameworks used for testing React Native components, Zustand stores, and database interactions. Provide practical examples of test cases for critical functionality such as user authentication, quiz scoring, and progress synchronization. Describe the test execution process, including running tests locally and in CI/CD pipelines. Address challenges specific to testing mobile applications like device fragmentation, offline scenarios, and gesture interactions. Include guidance on writing effective tests, maintaining test coverage, and debugging test failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Considerations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on security aspects of the STEM Learning App. Explain data privacy practices for student information in compliance with educational data protection standards. Detail secure storage implementation using Expo Secure Store for authentication tokens and sensitive user data. Describe database security measures including encryption, access controls, and secure query patterns in database.ts. Address authentication security practices documented in AUTH_GUIDE.md such as secure password handling and session management. Include guidance on protecting against common mobile application vulnerabilities like insecure data storage, code tampering, and reverse engineering. Provide recommendations for secure coding practices and regular security audits.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration & Environment Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on configuration management in the STEM Learning App. Explain how app.json controls application metadata, permissions, and platform-specific settings. Detail environment configuration through eas.json for different build profiles (development, preview, production). Describe how theme.ts manages UI configuration and how database.ts handles data layer configuration. Address the management of feature flags, API endpoints (if any), and environment variables across different deployment stages. Include best practices for configuration versioning, sensitive data handling, and environment-specific overrides. Provide troubleshooting guidance for configuration-related issues such as missing permissions or incorrect theme application.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: STEM Learning App

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The STEM Learning App is an offline-first, gamified educational platform designed to provide accessible STEM education for students aged 10-20 in Zambia. The application leverages React Native with Expo to deliver a comprehensive learning experience that functions entirely without internet connectivity.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Provide offline access to STEM educational content
- Implement gamification elements to increase user engagement
- Track and visualize learning progress through XP systems and leaderboards
- Deliver personalized learning recommendations through AI integration
- Create an accessible, intuitive interface optimized for mobile devices

### Target Audience
The primary target audience consists of Zambian students aged 10-20 who may have limited or unreliable internet access. The app is specifically designed to address educational disparities by providing high-quality STEM content that can be accessed anytime, anywhere.

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Interface] --> B[State Management]
    B --> C[Business Logic]
    C --> D[Data Access]
    D --> E[(SQLite Database)]
    A --> F[Theme System]
    A --> G[Navigation]
    C --> H[AI Services]
```

### Design Patterns
The application implements several key design patterns:
- **Zustand State Management**: Centralized store for user authentication, theme preferences, and learning progress
- **Expo Router**: File-based routing system for navigation between screens
- **Component Reusability**: Custom Button component with multiple variants and states
- **Theme Provider Pattern**: Dynamic light/dark theme switching with comprehensive styling system

### System Relationships
The application components interact through a well-defined hierarchy:

```mermaid
graph TD
    RootLayout[_layout.tsx] --> SplashScreen[index.tsx]
    SplashScreen --> WelcomeScreen[welcome.tsx]
    WelcomeScreen --> Tabs[(tabs)]
    Tabs --> Home[home.tsx]
    Tabs --> Learn[learn.tsx]
    Tabs --> Leaderboard[leaderboard.tsx]
    Tabs --> Profile[profile.tsx]
    Services[services/] --> Database[database.ts]
    Services --> Store[store.ts]
    Constants[constants/] --> Theme[theme.ts]
    Components[components/] --> Button[Button.tsx]
```

### Data Flow
The data flows through the application in a predictable manner:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Interaction] --> B[Component Event]
    B --> C[State Update]
    C --> D[Zustand Store]
    D --> E[Service Layer]
    E --> F[Database Operations]
    F --> G[(SQLite Storage)]
    G --> H[Data Retrieval]
    H --> I[State Update]
    I --> J[UI Rendering]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Root Layout**: `app/_layout.tsx` - Initializes app state and configures routing
- **Splash Screen**: `app/index.tsx` - Entry point with loading animation and authentication check
- **Welcome Screen**: `app/welcome.tsx` - Authentication interface for login and registration

### Core Modules
- **State Management**: `services/store.ts` - Zustand store for global state
- **Database Service**: `services/database.ts` - SQLite operations and data persistence
- **Theme System**: `constants/theme.ts` - Comprehensive styling and theming configuration

### Configuration Approach
- **App Configuration**: `app.json` - Expo application settings
- **Build Configuration**: `eas.json` - EAS build profiles
- **Development Configuration**: `metro.config.js` - Metro bundler settings

### External Dependencies
- **Core Dependencies**: `package.json` - React Native, Expo, and supporting libraries
- **State Management**: zustand - Lightweight state management
- **Database**: expo-sqlite - Local database operations
- **UI Components**: react-native-gesture-handler, react-native-reanimated - Enhanced user interactions

### Integration Points
- **Authentication**: `services/store.ts` - Secure user authentication with expo-secure-store
- **Database**: `services/database.ts` - Local data persistence with SQLite
- **Theme System**: `constants/theme.ts` - Dynamic theme switching and styling

### Component Relationships
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[RootLayout] --> B[SplashScreen]
    B --> C[WelcomeScreen]
    C --> D[Tab Navigation]
    D --> E[Home]
    D --> F[Learn]
    D --> G[Leaderboard]
    D --> H[Profile]
    I[StateStore] --> J[AllScreens]
    K[Theme] --> L[AllComponents]
    M[Database] --> N[Services]
    N --> O[UIComponents]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The application delivers a comprehensive set of features focused on STEM education:

- **Offline-First Architecture**: Complete functionality without internet connectivity
- **Gamification System**: XP levels, badges, and streak tracking
- **Progress Tracking**: Comprehensive learning progress visualization
- **Adaptive Learning**: AI-powered recommendations (stub implementation)
- **User Authentication**: Local authentication with secure storage

### Implementation Highlights
- **Splash Screen**: `app/index.tsx` - Animated splash with progress indicator
- **Authentication**: `app/welcome.tsx` - Comprehensive registration and login interface
- **Home Dashboard**: `app/(tabs)/home.tsx` - User stats and AI recommendations
- **Learning Interface**: `app/(tabs)/learn.tsx` - Subject browsing with progress tracking
- **Leaderboard**: `app/(tabs)/leaderboard.tsx` - Competitive ranking system
- **User Profile**: `app/(tabs)/profile.tsx` - Comprehensive user statistics and settings

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Splash
    Splash --> Authentication
    Authentication --> Home
    Authentication --> Learn
    Authentication --> Leaderboard
    Authentication --> Profile
    Home --> Learn : Navigate
    Home --> Leaderboard : Navigate
    Home --> Profile : Navigate
    Learn --> Lesson : Start Learning
    Lesson --> Quiz : Complete Lesson
    Quiz --> Results : Submit Answers
    Results --> Home : Return
    Results --> Leaderboard : View Ranking
```

Sources:
- [README.md](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\README.md)
- [package.json](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\package.json)
- [_layout.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\_layout.tsx)
- [index.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\index.tsx)
- [welcome.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\welcome.tsx)
- [home.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\(tabs)\home.tsx)
- [learn.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\(tabs)\learn.tsx)
- [leaderboard.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\(tabs)\leaderboard.tsx)
- [profile.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\app\(tabs)\profile.tsx)
- [Button.tsx](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\components\Button.tsx)
- [theme.ts](c:\Users\Bupe_Chola_Chiyana\Desktop\fyp\stem_learning_app\constants\theme.ts)
</blog>
